title.narrative: WFUNA project: "Danish Youth in Action for Human Rights" workshop, engagement

participating-org.narrative: World Federation of United Nations Associations

policy-marker.narrative: Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: promote and raise awareness amongst Danish youth about the HRC, the priorities and work of the Permanent Mission of Denmark to the UN and Denmark's Human Right Council Candidature

description.narrative: Denmark plays an important role in promoting dignity, dialogue and development within the HRC and is a candidate for a seat at the Council in 2019-2021. Throughout the HRC-mechanisms, Denmark in particular seeks to be a strong voice for the promotion of women's rights, indigenous peoples’ rights as well as for the prevention of torture. In addition, Denmark is through its development cooperation working to advance young people’s meaningful engagement within the UN. Yet, there is a general shortfall among Danish youth with regard to their knowledge about the important activities of the Council and Denmark’s work to advance the human rights agenda. This highlights the need to raise awareness about the Council and Denmark’s work in promoting the human rights and strengthen Danish youth’s capacity to engage in the promotion of the UN human rights agenda.
